lead_paragraph: American efforts to contain Chinese ambitions in the South China Sea depend on a ring of allies, but the region’s united front may be crumbling.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington, and Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing.

headline.print_headline: Philippines’ Deal With China on Disputed Sea Pokes Hole in U.S. Strategy
headline.main: Philippines’ Deal With China Pokes a Hole in U.S. Strategy

snippet: American efforts to contain Chinese ambitions in the South China Sea depend on a ring of allies, but the region’s united front may be crumbling....
abstract: Deal struck between Philippines and China that would allow fishermen to operate around disputed shoal in South China Sea sets disquieting precedent in region, as United States had created united front against China's expanding maritime claims with series of regional alliances; Malaysia has indicated its own alliances may be shifting toward China as well.
